channel.title: FLA Viewer?
channel.description: i have some fla files and my computer doesnt recognize them? ive downloaded Flash 8 and nothing is happening? can someone tell me whats wrong?

item.title: FLA Viewer?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

What the hell are you talking about. Click Browse… Then make sure at the top it says “Look in: Program Files”. If it doesn’t, then drop down the menu, click C:. Go to Program Files, Macromedia, Flash 8, Flash.exe. And did you download Flash 8 or not? Did you install it? If you’re having this much trouble with computers, you shouldn’t be doing Flash anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: FLA Viewer?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:132480”]Right Click > Open With… > Choose Program > Browse > Macromedia > Flash 8 > Flash.exe.
Alternatively… : Browse > Adobe > Flash CS3 > Flash.exe. I think that how it goes.

Make sure you have Flash 8, not Flash 8 Player.[/quote] umm yeah when i click browser Macromedia is not there… in system32 its there but no Flash 8… im having a VERy hard tim downloading Flash 8 and Flash CS3 Please Help?[br][size=1]Posted on: August 11, 2007, 01:56:58 PM[/size][hr]can you upload the 1 u have? cause i try to dl and it says “Unknown” or soemthing…[br][size=1]Posted on: August 11, 2007, 01:58:48 PM[/size][hr]wait… nvmd 1 sec lets see if it works

Read full topic

item.title: FLA Viewer?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Right Click > Open With… > Choose Program > Browse > Macromedia > Flash 8 > Flash.exe.
Alternatively… : Browse > Adobe > Flash CS3 > Flash.exe. I think that how it goes.

Make sure you have Flash 8, not Flash 8 Player.
